alert.note: Alert for Pocahontas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 14 at 12:58PM EDT until June 14 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston West Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Pocahontas County in northeastern West Virginia... * Until 115 PM EDT. * At 1258 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles north of Mountain Grove to Marlinton, moving south at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Marlinton, Buckeye, Minnehaha Springs and Frost. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
